intro: Aleuritia tenuiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved elder, is a deciduous shrub native to East Asia. It belongs to the Adoxaceae family and is characterized by its small, white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are typically hairy on the underside. It produces small, black berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. Aleuritia tenuiloba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
